subject: Sales
title: Handling Stage Fright
description: A quick, practical guide to Handling Stage Fright.

hook.text: Buffett once said public speaking terrified him so much he'd drive around the block to avoid it.

buildup.text: Stage fright is evolution's alarm. The brain reads an audience as a threat that must be escaped.

discovery.text: Cognitive reappraisal works: relabel anxiety as excitement. The body physically can't tell the difference.

twist.text: The best speakers aren't fearless at all. They've learned to perform brilliantly while still afraid.

climax.text: Breathe deeply, arrive early, and focus on helping the audience. Service replaces self-consciousness.

punchline.text: Fear doesn't disappear. Great speakers perform through it.

quiz.question: What is 'cognitive reappraisal' for stage fright?
